metadata.title: The New CEO’s Assistant
metadata.subtitle: Lite
metadata.description: You support a brilliant but chaotic CEO whose ideas move faster than the organisation can follow. Your role sits in the backstage space between strategy, loyalty, boundaries, and emotional navigation.
metadata.hint: Tests your Strategy mindset, Boundary strength, Loyalty style, and Information Processing / People-reading

dimensions.label: Strategic mindset
dimensions.description: How you structure chaos, prioritise, and make decisions under pressure

dimensions.label: Boundary mindset
dimensions.description: How you protect your time, energy, and role clarity

dimensions.label: Loyalty mindset
dimensions.description: How you balance commitment to CEO, company, and self

dimensions.label: Information & People Reading
dimensions.description: How you interpret signals, manage emotions, and navigate politics

scenes.label: Scene 1
scenes.title: The 5:12 AM Message
scenes.body:
Your day starts with a 5:12 AM voice note from the CEO: “I had 14 ideas overnight. Sort them. Also schedule a board update, check product metrics, and remind me to talk to Legal.”

No priorities. No structure. Just pure chaos.
scenes.tip: Your first move reveals your relationship with ambiguity.

options.label: A
options.desc: You stabilise chaos by building structure.

options.label: B
options.main: Ask the CEO which task comes first.

options.label: C
options.main: Forward the note to team leads for input.

options.label: D
options.main: Try to do everything at once.
options.desc: You absorb chaos instead of shaping it.

scenes.label: Scene 2
scenes.title: Everyone Wants Access
scenes.body:
By 9 AM, six executives message you: “I need 5 minutes.” “Urgent!” “Put me into the CEO’s calendar.”

You are the gatekeeper to a CEO with no time.

options.label: A
options.main: Block everyone and protect CEO’s deep work.
options.desc: You act as a strong shield.

options.label: C
options.main: Let everyone in to avoid conflict.

options.label: D
options.main: Ask the CEO who gets access.

scenes.label: Scene 3
scenes.title: The Bad News File
scenes.body:
A product manager messages you quietly: “The prototype failed.”

You must tell the CEO, who hates hearing failure.
scenes.tip: This choice reveals your courage and framing instincts.

options.label: A
options.main: Tell the CEO directly and clearly.

options.label: C
options.main: Present three solution paths along with the news.
options.desc: You merge truth with strategic framing.

scenes.label: Scene 4
scenes.title: The Political Landmine
scenes.body:
An SVP corners you in the hallway: “Hey… what’s the CEO thinking about our department?”

Their smile feels too friendly.
scenes.tip: This tests political awareness and boundary strength.

options.label: C
options.main: Ask why they want the information.
options.desc: You take control of the conversation.

options.label: D
options.main: Share details to gain political favour.

scenes.label: Scene 5
scenes.title: The Emotional Storm
scenes.body:
The CEO storms into your workspace: “Why is everything slow today? Am I the only one who cares?!”

You can feel the stress radiating.

options.label: B
options.desc: You absorb blame to cool the fire.

options.label: D
options.desc: You cut through the emotional noise.

scenes.label: Scene 6
scenes.title: Shadow You Arrives
scenes.body: A glitch flashes. A calmer, darker version of you appears: “You’re carrying the CEO. But who is carrying you?”
scenes.tip: Your answer reveals your identity anchor.

options.label: C
options.main: "I must think like a strategist, not a helper."

scenes.label: Scene 7
scenes.title: The Backstage Doors
scenes.body:
At the end of the corridor, three glowing doors appear:

Door 1 — The Guardian
Door 2 — The Strategic Operator
Door 3 — The Boundary-Strong Advisor
scenes.tip: Your final door shows who you become next.

options.label: C
options.desc: You support with strength, not sacrifice.

growthSuggestions.text: You give deeply and consistently. Strengthening boundaries will protect your sustainability.
You read people and situations well. Pair this with structure to elevate influence.
Your loyalty is powerful — but watch for over-accommodation or burnout.
Slow down and observe dynamics before acting. Political clarity strengthens decision-making.
Your mindset shows balance across backstage roles. Continue refining structure, boundaries, and strategic calm.
